content:
taylor Poling reporterSeptember  2015Leave a Comment

More stories from Taylor Poling

Taylor Poling

Social practice artist Naomi Natale was the speaker Friday night at the sixth Annual DaVinci Lecture Series at the Marshall University Visual Arts Center PERIOD Natale is the artistic director for the Art of Revolution which uses art as a tool to help change public opinion and inspire citizens to make social changes PERIOD

Natale gave an approximately  minute lecture on her current and future projects as well as what led drove her to complete each project PERIOD

Natales presentation began with a selfintroduction PERIOD Natale said she found her artistic path during college with photography PERIOD She then traveled to Kenya to start her photographic career PERIOD

While in Kenya Natale learned of  orphaned brothers who earned money in unique ways to support each other PERIOD One brother would create any object desired out of clay and the other would create small toy planes out of scrap metal that could apparently fly PERIOD Natale learned that these boys were missing in the village and suspected to be dead PERIOD

It was the story of the  boys that sparked Natales first project the Cradle Project PERIOD The Cradle Project was created to bring awareness and raise funds to help the  orphans in poverty in different areas of Africa PERIOD Artists from around the world created cradles from found materials PERIOD Artists made  cradles for the project PERIOD

Hundreds of empty cradles would speak volumes about loss Natale said PERIOD

Natale continued her presentation with a short film discussing the progress of her next project One Million Bones PERIOD The video which brought some to tears during the lecture contained personal interviews with participants of the project PERIOD

One Million Bones was a  and a half year project that created handmade bones to represent the millions lost due to African genocide PERIOD At the end of the project the bones were laid on the National Mall in Washington D.C PERIOD

Natale progressed to discuss the projects that are being developed Rhetoric in Revolution and En La Luz PERIOD

At the end of her lecture a question and answer session was held PERIOD One comment came from the dean of the College of Arts and Media Donald Van Horn PERIOD Van Horn referred to Natales presentation as one of the most powerful things he had ever seen PERIOD
